https://prez.dev/description.@value: The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operatorâ€™s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

Drilling of the borehole is completed, but operations involving the borehole are continuing (e.g. installation of production infrastructure, wirelogging, etc.). Note that in the Australian Coal Logging Standards v3.1 (CoalLog), 'completed' status is closer in meaning to 'abandoned' in this vocabulary).

The status of a borehole commencing from the rig being moved onsite up until the time that drilling is completed. Note that this stage does not include any operations at the drillsite and within the borehole that follow the completion of drilling the hole. Note that this corresponds to the status of 'drilling' in the PPDM Wellbore Status vocabulary 2014.

The status of a borehole during which fluids (commonly gas and water) are injected rather than produced, typically with the primary objective of maintaining/increasing reservoir pressure to enhance production. Injection wells are also used to dispose of treated wastewater, recharge aquifers, tap geothermal energy, and in environmental remediation for the cleanup of contaminated soil or groundwater; the concept includes injecting for permanent storage. Boreholes/wells are specifically designed/drilled for this purpose, although a production well can be converted into an injection well and vice versa.
A borehole/well that is actively monitoring reservoir, aquifer or other geological parameters, such as water level, water quality, fluid pressure.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The status of a borehole from the commencement to the completion of drilling operations, and including the production/investigation stages.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of a borehole from the commencement to the completion of drilling operations, and including the production/investigation stages.
The status of a borehole during which liquids or gas are being extracted from the borehole.
The status of a borehole that alternately produces and injects liquid or gas into a borehole.
